attributes.background:
It was not that long ago that a man who was recovering from a serious and weakening illness died in hospital, not from that but from legionairres desease due to water, used in showers, that had been allowed to stagnate!

Between 2003 and 2004, the figure were up, not down of MRSA on death certificates (22percent (955 to 1,168).

Al this, whilst the government has been saying for 10 years, not 4 that they are improving the NHS! But, one might ask, If they are so concerned about about the NHS standards, why haven't things improved? Is this 1918 or 2007?
